short_summary: Digital Twin Facility, Architectural & Engineering Design for the National Research Council Canada
description: The Contractor must complete an architectural design that includes all A&E disciplines required to submit a quality construction tender. The known disciplines are mechanical, electrical, and civil engineering.
full_summary:
---

### Tender Notice
#### **Digital Twin Facility, Architectural & Engineering Design**

**Competition ID:** 24-58019
**Title:**
The National Research Council Canada (NRC) is issuing a Request for Proposal to develop a Digital Twin Facility, Architectural & Engineering Design for a high-quality construction project. 

**Overview:**
The successful Contractor will be responsible for providing an architectural design that includes all necessary Architecture and Engineering disciplines. Three main disciplines are required: Mechanical, Electrical, and Civil Engineering.

**Context:**
The project is scheduled to commence on **July 1, 2024**, and concludes on **October 31, 2025**. Interested suppliers must review and prepare a submission in accordance with the requirements outlined in the accompanying documents.

**Key Information:**

- **Publication Date:** May 15, 2024
- **Tender Closing Date:** June 18, 2024 (14:00:00)
- **Contract Entity:** National Research Council Canada (NRC)
- **Regions of Opportunity:** Newfoundland and Labrador
- **Geographic Service Area:** Located in Newfoundland and Labrador
- **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
- **Procurement Method:** Competitive Open Bidding
- **Business Overview:** Suppliers must submit their proposal electronically through the Canada Buys (Canadabuys) portal. Contact information and links can be found in the documents provided.

**Attachments:**

- Digital Twin Facility, Architectural & Engineering Design (Outstanding Architectural and Engineering Designs Package)
- Request for Proposal (RFP) Document
- Supplementaries Package

**Specifically, Suppliers Must Adhere To:**

- Ensure that their submissions address the requirements outlined in the Request for Proposal Document.
- Supplier’s Bélanger Act & “Compliance to threats, injuries & damage” declarations for any Canada Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) certification
